STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
June 26, 2025
Tanya Marie Oberlin
GOOD SAMARITAN RESCUE MISSION
713 9TH ST,
BAY CITY, MI, 48708-6403
Re: License #: CI090396004
Dear Ms. Oberlin:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 06/25/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective action
plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be completed
or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Tyler Armstrong, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
(989) 264-9217
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4167-2 Case record maintenance
(2) Service plans shall be signed and dated by the
social services worker and the social services
supervisor.
One out of two youth files reviewed did not contain documentation with proper
staff and supervision signatures for review and approval.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Technical assistance was provided in the area of staff being on leave and following
licensing requirements for applicable responsibilities for those positions.
V. CONSULTATION
Consultation was provided in the area of long-term plans for construction at the
facility and compliance with licensing rules.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: There
was one corrective action plan during this reporting period, stemming from the last
interim inspection. This CAP contained action steps related to timely employee
evaluations. These action steps were followed as there were no repeat violations
for this rule during this inspection.
Financial Overview
Current budgeting and an independent financial overview covering the calendar
year of 2024 for the previous year was provided and reviewed. No concerns were
noted and the organization demonstrated sufficient financing.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator assessment dated 05/14/2025 was provided and
reviewed. The facility only had one unplanned discharge during the reporting
period, an AWOL that was reported to DCWL properly. They reviewed one CAP
and action steps related to timely employee evaluations.

Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff were interviewed during the unannounced, face-to-face visit on 05/12/2025.
Staff reported feeling well trained and supported in the program, and they enjoyed
working with the CCI youth as well as the other kinds of youth served by the
organization's services.
No youth were interviewed during this inspection as there were no youth admitted
at the time of inspection.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The facility was toured during the unannounced, face-to-face visit on 05/12/2025.
No concerns were noted. No youth were placed, so the bedroom areas were
clean and organized. Despite no youth placed there were adequate supplies
ready for the next placement.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
06/25/2025
___________________________________________________________
Tyler Armstrong Date
